channel.title: Programming on Brey Laude
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Brey Laude

item.title: Real Programming - Tutorial
item.description: I was watching some random finance lectures and it gave lectures with a list of financial advice and it starts out by “What is finance”, breakdown into two things, if you want to get into it you have a choice, you can either invest your own money or other people’s money - investing your own money probably only makes sense if you have a lot of it, you need tools to, like there’s no reason you should be investing your money if somebody else can invest it better. Basically good advice so I thought I’d do something similar for programming.

item.title: My favorite programming pattern
item.description:
So at work we were talking about interviewer questions for graduates, and one of them was the standard simple test to weed out graduates who faked it till they made it. it went something like this:

You are given a list of characters, please return the list with commas seperating each element. do not leave a trailing comma.

There may have been language restrictions or something, honestly I wasn’t paying a huge amount of attention, but it got me thinking about my honest answer to that, and here is what I came up with.
